label: 調
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A tax levied only on taxable males (kakō, or kachō), payable generally in cloth, plus native products of the region in which a man lived. First class males (seichō) paid twice as much as second class males (jichō), and four times as much as third-class males (chūnan).
